items.content_html:
This copies some version numbers from the corresponding SVG*Element
interfaces. It's always possible the markup was supported before the
APIs, but this is too far back in time to warrant investigation.
items.title: Update SVG element data from the corresponding APIs

items.content_html:
FF112 supports CanvasRenderingContext2D/roundRect() in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1756175

This applies to the same method in OffscreenCanvas2d and path2D. The offscreen support wasn't obvious from the issue (to me) but is obvious when you run the offscreen path roundrect tests in FF111 vs FF112 http://wpt.live/html/canvas/offscreen/path-objects/

Other docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#25359
items.title: FF112 supports roundRect() on Canvas2D

items.content_html:
FF112 enables navigator.getAutoplayPolicy() by default in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1812189
This removes the pref and changes the preview version to 112.

Related docs work can be tracked in mdn/content#25362
items.title: FF112 navigator.getAutoplayPolicy() enabled on release

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates Firefox to version 111

  • https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/111.0/releasenotes/
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Firefox/Releases/111
items.title: Update firefox to version 111

items.content_html:
Summary

The shorthand and longhand properties, scroll-timeline, scroll-timeline-name,
scroll-timeline-axis, are still behind a preference but the flag name was changed in Fx110 because of the change in spec.

Flag name before: layout.css.scroll-linked-animations.enabled
Flag name now: layout.css.scroll-driven-animations.enabled

via https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1807685

Related doc issues and bugs

(The flag name was changed in Fx110 but other changes requiring content updates happened in Fx111.)

  • Fx111 Doc issue tracker: mdn/content#24396 (bugzilla: 1804573)
  • Spec: https://w3c.github.io/csswg-drafts/scroll-animations/#scroll-timeline-shorthand

Related issue

This PR partly (the Firefox part) fixes the issue #19086. Awaiting more information about the version in which support was added in Chrome and Edge. I'll probably open a separate PR for updating Chrome info in BCD.
items.title: Fx110: flag name change for scroll-timeline shorthand and longhand properties

items.content_html:
Summary

Added data for the prefers-reduced-transparency media query as Firefox now supports in 113 behind a pref.

Test results and supporting details

New WPT tests: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/css/mediaqueries/prefers-reduced-transparency.html

Gecko bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1736914
WebKit bug: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=175497 (unimplemented)
Blink bug: Does not exist currently
items.title: Add data for prefers-reduced-transparency media query

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing features of the ReadableStream API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v8.1.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/ReadableStream

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add missing features for ReadableStream API

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds a compatibility and spec's for the SVG shape-subtract attribute. A follow up to my PR adding this item to the MDN docs.

First time contributor here, please feel free to let me know if there was something I could've done better.

Test results and supporting details

In my testing for compatibility I was unable to find a browser that supported this feature, even though it is on the standards track.

Testing as Not Supported in:

  • Chrome: 110.0.581.178
  • Firefox: 110.0.1
  • Opera: 95.0.4635.46
  • Edge: 110.0.1587.63

But there are some resources that indicate it could be a WIP:

  • Chromium Bug report asking for this feature support
  • Chromium Test Cases for this Feature
  • Firefox Test Cases for this Feature

Also if helpful, the specification.

Related issues

Supplies my companion PR mdn/content#25077 with it's compatibility table and specification link.
items.title: Add `shape-subtract` compatibility data
